data.title: French Forces Begin Central African Operations After UN Vote
data.meta_description: France sent more troops and helicopters to Central African Republic as its forces on the ground began patrols in the capital after the United Nations backed military operations to stabilize the country.
data.text:
France sent more troops and helicopters to Central African Republic as its forces on the ground began patrols in the capital after the United Nations backed military operations to stabilize the country.

French soldiers will probably be in the country for at least six months, Defense Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian said in an interview broadcast on Radio France Internationale. Central African Republic Prime Minister Nicolas Tiangaye said he wants French troops to remain there for a full year, the minimum amount of time he said is needed to impose order.
